element_text:
usual amortisation and depreciation. If this applies,
impairment for loss is made of each asset or group of
assets, respectively, to lower recoverable amount.
As recoverable amount, the higher of expected net selling
price and net present value is applied. The net present
value is calculated as the present value of the anticipated
cash flows from the use of the asset or the group of
assets.
Impairment for loss for the year is recognised in the
income statement as amortisation, depreciation and
